result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan Robert Eder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 15CF2588.  Straight time.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waved the DNA surcharge because it is a part of a continuous course of conduct with case 15CF2588.
____
Comply with all conditions of Extended Supervision as ordered in case 15CF2588.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Alan Robert Eder in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 25.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 25 in jury trial. Branch 44 agreed to take this case. Parties notified.

ADA Mineo notified the Court he has a prior training obligation and will not be available until 10:30 a.m. Defense counsel notified and does not object to scheduling this matter at that time. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Alan Robert Eder not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense anticipates a resolution in this matter and requests a plea and sentencing date. ADA Mineo will be handling this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution worksheet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary Report, received and filed.
Defendant previously posted $1,000.00 cash. Defendant needs to post an additional $1,000.00.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. Discussion regarding Justice Point violations. Sidebar placed on the record. Court did not modify cash bail in this case. Case remains scheduled for scheduling conference on 9/15/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Court ordered this matter be set for a bail hearing to address the violation report. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 9/03/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Bail/Bond Hearing in Branch 25. Defense counsel advised the defendant must appear in court. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation report - two (2) missed office contacts - received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties are pursuing alternative treatment options for the defendant and request an adjourned scheduling date. Court granted joint request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

07-07-2015

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Alan Robert Eder not in court, in custody.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Appearance of the defendant waived for todays proceedings.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter; date selected.   Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25, Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/allowing substitution of attorneys, received and filed.
/for Substitution of Attorneys, received and filed.
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered bail set the amount of $1,000.00 CASH, with TOT to Justice Point: no weapons or firearms; no drugs or alcohol; random testing.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Alan Robert Eder not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  Attorney Matthew Meyer also appeared in court, advising the court that his client has retained him as counsel; Stipulation for Substitution of Attorneys received and filed; approved by the Court.  Attorney Meyer is now the attorney of record; Attorney Dick excused.

Defense counsel requested a scheduling date, as defendant has picked up another case (15CF2588) which was just in Preliminary Hearing court yesterday.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 20 not in session on 6/09/15.  Case is rescheduled with parties' agreement to 6/19/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Discharge Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6/03/15.  Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Justice Point DPA Progress Report, received and filed.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; needs an offer.  Court warned defendant to remain in compliance with conditions of bail, and indicated that defendant must go to Justice Point after court today.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue. Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Oral No Contact Order with Mark G.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/22/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alan Robert Eder in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Alan Robert Eder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
